main event: A silvery reflective object was observed moving laterally without sound, disintegrating into 3-4 pieces during its flight on June 8, 1954.
interesting points: The object was oval-shaped and the size of a baseball at an arm's length., The object traveled at an estimated speed of 300-400 mph., The sighting lasted for about 20-30 seconds., It was noted that radar from Pope AFB was in the air at the time of the sighting., Two aircraft from Pope AFB were in the area but found no unusual objects.
witness description: Lieutenant Colonel G. D. Adams and Major E. C. Broadhurst from Fort Bragg
